intro: Ruellia scarlatina, commonly known as the scarlet ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls at the ends of the stems. Ruellia scarlatina is valued in horticulture for its vibrant color and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
